articles.author: Maya Gebeily, Laila Bassam
articles.description: It was the first attack within city limits as Israel escalated hostilities against Iran's allies in the region.
articles.title: Apartment building in Beirut hit as Israel widens air campaign

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: For Israel, the death of Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah has been a moment to savour, uplifting spirits for a country still grappling with the trauma of the Oct. 7 Hamas attack and almost a year of war, and providing a boost to once-embattled Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.
articles.title: Netanyahu boosted as Israel regains confidence with Nasrallah hit

articles.author: Francois Murphy
articles.description: Austria's far-right Freedom Party (FPO) must on Monday seek to clear a path to power after its historic parliamentary election victory left the anti-establishment outfit needing a partner to form a governing coalition.
articles.title: Austrian far right seeks path to power through rivals' blockade

articles.author: Andrew Gray
articles.description: NATO members should not be deterred from giving more military aid to Ukraine by Vladimir Putin's "reckless Russian nuclear rhetoric", outgoing NATO boss Jens Stoltenberg told Reuters in an interview on Monday.
articles.title: Putin's nuclear talk shouldn't stop NATO backing Ukraine, Stoltenberg says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Group of Seven (G7) countries want to reach a political agreement on the $50 billion loan for Ukraine by the end of October for the cash to be able to available before the end of this year, a senior European Commission official said on Monday.
articles.title: G7 aims to finalise deal on $50 bln loan to Ukraine by end-Oct, EU says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Emergency responders in North Carolina were racing to try to reach people who remain unaccounted for after the hurricane hit, killing nearly 100 people, wiping out communications and leaving millions without power.
articles.title: Hurricane Helene leaves dozens dead, many missing across US Southeast

articles.author: Daniel Wiessner
articles.description: The U.S. Department of Justice has agreed to pay $22.6 million to settle a lawsuit by 34 women who claim they were wrongly dismissed from the FBI's agent training academy because of their sex, according to a court filing on Monday.
articles.title: FBI will pay $22.6 million to settle female trainees' sex bias claims

articles.author: Timour Azhari, Abdelhadi Ramahi
articles.description: The Amro family household in Lebanon's lush Keserwan mountains had become a refuge for families who wanted to stay outside the line of fire of creeping war in the country's south.
articles.title: Deadly Israeli strikes hit Lebanon's war displaced

articles.author: Juliette Jabkhiro
articles.description: Marine Le Pen, the leading figure of France's far-right National Rally (RN) party, went on trial on Monday accused of misappropriating EU funds and said she was confident she would prove she did nothing wrong.
articles.title: French far-right leader Le Pen stands trial over alleged misuse of EU funds

articles.author: Lisandra Paraguassu, Sergio Queiroz
articles.description: Sonia Ferreira's two-story house with a pool and garden on the Brazilian coast was yet another casualty of the advancing waves of the Atlantic Ocean, pushed higher by climate change.
articles.title: Brazil's coast eroding faster than ever as Atlantic advances
